title: Energy conservation - particle moves from V1 to V2

content.question: A particle of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> has an unknown charge. The particle is in a region of uniform electric field, represented by the equipotential lines shown in the figure. The particle is released from rest at a location with electric potential <math alttext="uppercase V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. It then travels toward the right, and has a speed <math alttext="lowercase v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> at the instant it is passing through a location with electric potential <math alttext="uppercase V sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. What is the charge of the particle?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m lowercase v squared, and denominator 2 uppercase V sub 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>
